Scientists plan to build a graviton detector. Why is it so hard?
description: Gravity is one of nature’s four fundamental forces; the others are electromagnetism and the strong and weak nuclear forces. And gravity is 1 billion billion billion billion times weaker than the electromagnetic force, the next strongest. This is why a fridge magnet can overcome the gravitational pull of the entire earth to pick up a paperclip

description: Pakistan has halted preparations for the T20 World Cup 2026, backing Bangladesh's refusal to play in India due to security concerns. Islamabad has indicated it may withdraw if the issue isn't resolved, following Bangladesh's withdrawal from the IPL. The ICC is reluctant to shift Bangladesh's matches, potentially leading to Scotland's replacement.

title: 'No matter who you are': Rohit's 'real hunger' questioned after poor series
description: Rohit Sharma’s poor run continued with an 11-run dismissal in the deciding ODI against New Zealand on Sunday, raising questions about his form and motivation. Now playing only ODIs, Rohit struggled throughout the series, prompting Simon Doull to question whether the 2027 World Cup is too distant to drive him. Doull also cited limited ODI cricket as a factor. Virat Kohli topped the series with 240 runs.

title: ‘Non-recognition can’t be ground for shutting madarsa’: Allahabad HC orders to remove seal in 24 hours
HC refuses to suspend Sengar jail term in custody death case
description: The Delhi High Court denied suspended jail term for expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the custodial death case of the Unnao rape survivor's father. The court cited the grave nature of the offense, Sengar's criminal history, and the trial court's findings, emphasizing that the delay in trial was partly due to Sengar's legal team's actions.

The Election Commission will showcase its intensive electoral roll revision initiative, despite opposition concerns. The event will feature discussions on global electoral issues, best practices, and the launch of the ECINET digital platform.

The post honored Natalia's journey, her connection to Kobe's legacy through Nike, and her burgeoning career in cinema and modeling. The touching message also included late husband Kobe and daughter Gianna, highlighting enduring family love.

The visit also saw commitments to double bilateral trade to $200 billion by 2032 and explore significant infrastructure development in Gujarat.

title: EAM to Poland: Stop fuelling terror infra
description: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar urged Poland to adopt a zero-tolerance stance on terrorism, advising against supporting terrorist infrastructure in India's vicinity. He also voiced India's displeasure over what he termed "selective targeting" by European nations regarding the Russia-Ukraine war and trade relations with Russia, deeming it unfair and unjustified.

title: List WB voters with ‘logical discrepancy’: SC to poll panel
description: The Supreme Court has ordered the Election Commission to display lists of West Bengal voters facing "logical discrepancy" notices in panchayat and block offices, granting them an additional 10 days to submit proof of credentials. The court also directed the state to provide manpower and ensure law and order for the special intensive revision drive.

title: Flight duty norms: DGCA exemptions end on Feb 10, IndiGo may cut more flights
description: IndiGo may reduce flights after February 10 as a DGCA exemption for new flight-duty rules expires. The airline plans a "short-term network readjustment," potentially shifting some A320 routes to ATR aircraft to avoid major disruptions. Affected passengers will be informed and offered refunds or alternative flights.

title: Boost for defence exports as Rajnath flags off 1st batch of Pinaka guided rockets for Armenia
description: India has achieved a significant milestone in defense exports by flagging off the first batch of guided Pinaka rocket systems for Armenia. This move underscores India's growing prowess as a reliable supplier of advanced defense technology, transitioning from an importer to a major exporter. The Pinaka system, known for its accuracy and range, highlights the nation's burgeoning defense industry.

description: Former Pakistan captain Ramiz Raja faced an awkward moment during the toss of a BPL 2025–26 match when his call to “make some noise” was met with near silence. The clip went viral on social media, drawing mixed reactions. While some mocked the moment, others defended Raja, citing poor acoustics or early crowd turnout. Raja quickly moved on and continues as a prominent voice in the league.

Yunus defends minority-violence in Bangladesh, says only 71 of 645 incidents 'communal'
description: Bangladesh's interim government claims most 2025 incidents involving minorities were criminal, not communal. Out of 645 cases, only 71 had religious motives, including temple vandalism and threats. The government emphasizes accurate classification to combat misinformation, but minority groups question the assessment, fearing it emboldens criminals.

'Deceived, not enemy soldiers': Amnesty window open for youth in Iran 'riots'
description: Protests erupted across Iran in late December over economic hardship, escalating into anti-regime unrest. Authorities report thousands of deaths, widespread arrests, and violent clashes, particularly in Kurdish regions. Supreme Leader Khamenei vowed harsh punishment, blaming foreign interference. Police offered leniency to “deceived” protesters. While cities show signs of calm and limited internet restoration, tensions and restrictions persist amid continuing government crackdowns.

Type 075 ship: The ace up Xi's sleeve? All about China's trump card for Taiwan takeover
description: China’s Type 075 amphibious assault ships have become a prominent symbol of Beijing’s rising military pressure on Taiwan. Their deployment in large-scale drills encircling the island in December highlighted their importance to any future cross-strait operation. Combining helicopter operations, landing craft and troop deployment, the vessels significantly enhance China’s amphibious and power-projection capabilities, reshaping the regional security balance.

description: South Africa comprehensively dominated the West Indies in the 1998-99 Test series, securing a 5-0 whitewash. The final Test saw South Africa win by 351 runs, leading to the entire Proteas team being named Player of the Match in a rare decision.

description: Blues forward Oskar Sundqvist suffered a deep skate cut above his ankle after a collision with Connor McDavid. While head coach Jim Montgomery confirmed the injury did not touch his Achilles, the severity of the cut leaves his return timeline uncertain. Sundqvist is listed as day-to-day, impacting the Blues' forward depth.

He argues that cutting first-party content development, which heavily competed with third-party studios, will foster a healthier ecosystem and allow independent developers to thrive.

A 'golden' bid for dominance: Decoding Trump's Greenland grab; knock-out blow for Russia, China?
description: Donald Trump's renewed focus on Greenland, linked to his 'Golden Dome' missile defence proposal, signals a strategic shift.  This Arctic island is seen as vital for US national security, offering a crucial vantage point against Russia and China.  The ambitious 'Golden Dome' aims for near-invulnerability, sparking global concerns over strategic stability and the militarisation of space.

title: India on cusp of upper-middle income status: Per capita income to rise; economy set to be 3rd largest
description: India’s climb up the income ladder was slow for decades, taking 60 years to move from low income to lower-middle income. Since then, growth has sharply accelerated, and a likely transition into the upper-middle-income category by around 2030.

title: Matthew Stafford’s family turns heads in Chicago with matching Rams style
description: Matthew Stafford and the Los Angeles Rams braved snowy Chicago for an NFC clash against the Bears. Despite an MVP-worthy season with 4,707 yards and 46 touchdowns, Stafford has never won the award. His wife Kelly and their four daughters cheered him on in matching custom Rams jackets, highlighting their family support as Stafford pursues his second Super Bowl in his 17th NFL season.

title: 'I chose it out of passion': Google founder Sergey Brin on studying computer science
description: Google co-founder Sergey Brin recently shared insights on the evolving value of higher education in the age of AI. He emphasized that passion and curiosity, rather than just credentials, drive success, even as AI capabilities grow. Brin also noted Google's shift towards hiring "self-taught stars" with proven skills over solely relying on traditional degrees.

title: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife's donations questioned - What it revealed?
description: MacKenzie Scott, ex-wife of Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: Bill Belichick joins ESPN as UNC looks ahead after disappointing 4–8 season
description: Bill Belichick will appear on ESPN’s ACC Network broadcast of the College Football Playoff national championship game in South Florida. The TV role comes weeks after his first season as North Carolina’s head coach ended at 4–8. Belichick is also focused on recruiting, including adding quarterback Billy Edwards Jr. ahead of the Tar Heels’ April 12 spring game.

title: Larsa Pippen shuts down LiAngelo Ball dating rumors, ends gossip
description: Larsa Pippen has vehemently denied a viral deepfake rumor linking her to rapper LiAngelo Ball.  The AI-generated image, which depicted an intimate pose, caused a stir online. Pippen, currently dating basketball star Jeff Coby, urged fans to cease creating such fabricated content, emphasizing the distress it causes. She clarified her relationship status, putting an end to the baseless speculation.
